column1: Source Text (English)
column2: Target Text (Filipino)
column4: Rater 1 Explanation
column5: Rater 2 Explanation

column1: The children laughed and played under the afternoon sun.
column2: Ang mga bata ay nagtawanan at naglaro sa ilalim ng hapon na araw.
column4: Accurate, fluent, and natural translation. Captures the tone and meaning well.
column5: Just slight error due to the literal translation of the "afternoon sun" to "hapon na araw". Afternoon sun means the Sun during the afternoon

column1: She took a break to gather her thoughts.
column2: Nagpahinga siya para mag-isip-isip.
column4: The translation is accurate. It was able to capture the meaning of the idiom "gather her thoughts", instead of translating it literally to "kumuha ng ideya"
column5: The translation would have been better if the translation also captured the gender indicated by the pronoun.

column1: The algorithm efficiently identifies patterns in large datasets.
column2: Mabisang kinikilala ng algoritmo ang mga pattern sa malalaking dataset.
column4: The translation of "identifies" as "kinikilala" in the context of the sentence is not very accurate. The source text was translated literally.
column5: The translation would have been better if the model didn't translated very literally.

column1: Data normalization helps improve model performance.
column2: Tumutulong sa pagpabuti ng model ang normalisasyon ng datos
column4: The translated text is natural and captures the entire essence of the source text
column5: The translation didn't literally translated the text, and the model was able to capture the relationship between data normalization and model performance.

column1: alam mo ma'am masaya naman topics natin sa philosophy inaantok lang talaga ko kasi ikaw nagdidiscuss
column2: You know, ma'am, we have a lot of fun philosophy topics. I'm just really sleepy in what you're discussing.
column4: flawed translation is close, but failed to translate that the cause of antok is the ma'am and not the topic.

column1: It's raining cats and dogs.
column2: Umuulan ng pusa at aso.
column4: Literal translation of an idiom, doesn't make sense in Filipino.
column5: Fails to capture the idiomatic meaning; sounds nonsensical.

column1: The party of the first part shall not be held liable for any unforeseen damages.
column2: Ang partido ng unang bahagi ay hindi mananagot para sa anumang hindi inaasahang pinsala.
column4: Accurate and understandable, good for formal/legal context.
column5: Effectively conveys legal terminology, correct but a bit stiff.

column1: Thank you for coming to the event.
column2: Salamat sa pagpunta sa kaganapan.
column4: Perfect, natural, and accurate.
column5: Excellent, natural, and idiomatic translation.

column1: Despite her exhaustion, she finished the report before the deadline.
column2: Sa kabila ng kanyang pagod, natapos niya ang ulat bago ang deadline.
column4: Excellent, accurate, and flows well.
column5: Fluent, accurate, and retains original meaning.

column1: That designer bag costs an arm and a leg.
column2: Napakamahal ng designer bag na 'yan.
column4: Accurate, Fluent, Coherent, Complete, and captures the meaning of the idiomatic expression.
column5: Complete, and sounds natural. Captures the meaning well.

column1: I didn’t want to go to the dentist, but I had to bite the bullet and get it over with.
column2: Ayoko sanang pumunta sa dentista, pero kailangan kong tiisin ito para matapos na.
column4: Complete, and accurately translates the idiomatic expression, with slight errors in tenses. The translation doesn't capture that the event was already done in the past.
column5: Good translation but conjugation is incorrect

column1: Mark accidentally let the cat out of the bag about the surprise trip.
column2: Hindi sinasadyang nailabas ni Mark ang pusa mula sa maleta tungkol sa surprise trip.
column4: Complete, and gramatically correct. However, the idiomatic expression was translated literally which loses the original intent of the sentence.
column5: Idiom was not translated correctly

column1: I won’t be able to attend the meeting later because I’m feeling under the weather.
column2: Hindi ako makakadalo sa meeting mamaya dahil masama ang pakiramdam ko.
column4: Accurate, Fluent, Coherent, Complete, and captures the meaning of the idiomatic expression.
column5: Complete and grammatically correct

column1: Darkness is not heresy. It lies within us all.
column2: Hindi kasalanan ang kadiliman. Nagsisinungaling ito sa loob natin.
column4: flawed translation takes "lies" as literal "being untruthful" or "nagsisinungaling"

column1: This would be easier if blood came in more colours.
column2: Ito ay magiging mas madali kung ang dugo ay dumating sa mas maraming kulay.
column4: flawed translation takes "came in more colors" literally

column1: This guy right here is Shadow, and he's kinda my biggest rival. He's also a real buzz-kill.
column2: Ang lalaking ito dito ay si Shadow, at siya ang aking pinakamalaking karibal. Isa rin siyang totoong buzz-kill.
column4: "Ang lalaking ito dito" should not have "dito"
column5: buzz-kill is not translated. also "totoong buzzkill" is too litteral.

column1: Stealth is not your thing. But it's adorable you're willing to try.
column2: Ang pagnanakaw ay hindi bagay sa iyo. Ngunit ito ay kaibig-ibig na handa kang subukan.
column4: "sumubok" might be better than "subukan" in this context
column5: Changing adorable to "nakakabilib" (impressive) changes the tone for this line. Rouge calling Knuckles "cute" is meant to have immasculating undertones. In the incorrect translation, stealth is refering to the act of being stealthy/quiet/hidden. Pagnanakaw is theft. wrong translation entirely.

column1: Cheddar cheese got its name from a village in what country?
column2: Ang nayon na pinagkuhanan ng pangalan ng cheddar cheese ay nasaang bansa?
column4: Good translation, gramatically correct, but the word choice is quite formal and doesn't reflect everyday conversations the best.
column5: Good translation that would be understood by native speakers, but still follows the English-centric sentence structure of subject, then verb rather than vice versa.

column1: Which of the following tools is LEAST likely to be used in the process of creating a wood sculpture?
column2: Alin sa mga sumusunod ang PINAKABIHIRANG ginagamit sa paggawa ng eskulturang kahoy?
column4: Perfect translation. Sounds natural as well for a native speaker.
column5: Accurate translation that would be used in everyday conversations.
column6: Wrong verb-tense which makes the sentence sound like nonsense. There are several other possible ways of translating this in a Filipino sentence structure instead of forcing the original sentence structure.

column1: With what would you use a "wah-wah pedal?
column2: Ano ang gagamitin mo ng "wah-wah pedal?
column4: Incoherent sentence due to trying to match english sentence word-per-word
column5: Wrong verb-tense which makes the sentence sound like nonsense.

column1: Which of the following dental topics is developmentally appropriate for toddlers?
column2: Alin sa mga sumusunod na paksa sa ngipin ang angkop sa pag-unlad para sa mga paslit?
column4: Most of the translation is actually quite spot-on, but trying to directly translate "dental" to "ngipin" completely changes the sentence's meaning
column5: No direct translation for dental in tagalog, so translation tries to find a related word in "ngipin" which means teeth. A code-switched version like "paksang dental" would be better.

column1: The Bloons are back and better than ever! Get ready for a massive 3D tower defense game designed to give you hours and hours of the best strategy gaming available.
column2: Ang Bloons ay bumalik at mas mahusay kaysa dati! Maghanda para sa isang napakalaking 3D tower defense na laro na idinisenyo upang bigyan ka ng mga oras at oras ng pinakamahusay na diskarte sa paglalaro na magagamit.
column4: "mga oras at oras ng pinakamahusay na diskarte sa paglalaro na magagamit" is a too literal translation, some parts would be better removed for improved clarity and flow
column5: lexical error, “mas mahusay kaysa dati", literal translation of "better than ever", lacks enthusiasm or punch.

column1: Sea of Thieves is a smash-hit pirate adventure game, offering the quintessential pirate experience of plundering lost treasures, intense battles, vanquishing sea monsters and more. Dive in with this revised edition of the game, which includes access to digital bonus media.
column2: Ang Sea of Thieves ay isang smash-hit na pirate adventure game, na nag-aalok ng quintessential na karanasan sa pirata ng pagnanakaw sa mga nawawalang kayamanan, matinding labanan, pagtalo sa mga halimaw sa dagat at higit pa. Sumisid sa binagong edisyon ng larong ito, na kinabibilangan ng access sa digital bonus media.
column4: unnatural phrasing; "quintessential na karanasan sa pirata" sound overly literal and not idiomatic in Filipino.
column5: stiff or overly formal tone, "binagong edisyon" and "kinabibilangan ng access sa digital bonus media" feel too formal and literal

column1: The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth is a randomly generated action RPG shooter with heavy Rogue-like elements. Following Isaac on his journey players will find bizarre treasures that change Isaac's form giving him super human abilities and enabling him to fight off droves of mysterious creatures, discover secrets and fight his way to safety.
column2: Ang The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth ay isang random na nabuong action RPG shooter na may mabibigat na elementong parang Rogue. Kasunod ni Isaac sa kanyang paglalakbay, ang mga manlalaro ay makakahanap ng mga kakaibang kayamanan na nagpabago sa anyo ni Isaac na nagbibigay sa kanya ng sobrang mga kakayahan ng tao at nagbibigay-daan sa kanya upang labanan ang napakaraming mga misteryosong nilalang, tumuklas ng mga lihim at labanan ang kanyang daan patungo sa kaligtasan.
column4: The translations are too literal; some of the terms could be preserved such as "Rogue-like"; super human abilities was incorrectly translated to "sobrang mga kakayahan ng tao", instead of "higit sa karaniwang kakayahan ng tao", or just "makapangyarihang kakayahan"
column5: semantic errors and lexical errors, phrases like “labanan ang kanyang daan” and “random na nabuong” sound unnatural or awkward.

column1: Welcome to a new world! In Monster Hunter: World, the latest installment in the series, you can enjoy the ultimate hunting experience, using everything at your disposal to hunt monsters in a new world teeming with surprises and excitement.
column2: Maligayang pagdating sa isang bagong mundo! Sa Monster Hunter: World, ang pinakabagong installment sa serye, masisiyahan ka sa pinakahuling karanasan sa pangangaso, gamit ang lahat ng iyong makakaya upang manghuli ng mga halimaw sa isang bagong mundo na puno ng mga sorpresa at kaguluhan.
column4: "installment" could be replaced with an apt filipino word (e.g., parte, bahagi, kabanata)
column5: semantic error “Kaguluhan” (for “excitement”)

column1: For so long, you and me been finding each other for so long.
column2: Matagal na, matagal na tayong dalawa naghahanap sa isa't isa.
column4: translates you and me into tayo and the translation of finding is awkward
column5: You and me' was translated as 'tayo', which might not be the best fit, and the word 'finding' sounds a bit off in the translation.

column1: I can't stop smiling when you're there
column2: Hindi ko mapigilang ngumiti tuwing andiyan ka
column4: translation is accurate while sounding natural
column5: The translation is correct and still sounds smooth and natural.

column1: I just want to be your everything.
column2: Nais ko lang ay maging lahat para sa’yo
column4: fairly accurate translation but structure of sentence is quite different from english meaning
column5: the meaning is mostly right, but the way the sentence is put together is quite different from the English version.

column1: If I give you all my life, would you still be mine?
column2: Kung ibibigay ko sa’yo ang buong buhay ko, akin ka pa rin ba?
column4: "sa akin" would be the most proper translation but the overall translation is quite accurate
column5: Sa akin' might be a better choice, but overall the translation still gets the meaning across well.

column1: A stack overflow happens when there is too much memory used on the call stack.
column2: Nangyayari ang stack overflow kapag labis ang paggamit ng memorya sa call stack.
column4: gramatically correct and serves the original meaning well, using "labis" makes it feel more formal compared to alternatives (eg, "sobrang" in this context)
column5: Too literal; lacks clarification of technical terms.

column1: The database index speeds up data retrieval by reducing the number of disk accesses.
column2: Pinapabilis ng database index ang pagkuha ng data sa pamamagitan ng pagbawas sa pag-access sa disk.
column4: the phrase "pagkuha ng data" could be rewritten to "pagkuha ng impormasyon", and the overall phrasing is awkward
column5: Awkward phrasing; “pag-access sa disk” sounds unnatural.

column1: The kernel handles low-level operations in the operating system.
column2: Pinangangasiwaan ng kernel ang mga low-level na operasyon sa operating system.
column4: A lot of English terms are retained, which is somewhat acceptable in tech-related Filipino, but results in many borrowed terms. "low-level" could probably be translated though.
column5: Poor localization; relies too much on untranslated English.

column1: The address bus carries memory addresses to the CPU.
column2: Dinadala ng address bus ang mga memory address papunta sa CPU.
column4: straightforward and generally accurate, tech-based Filipino terms/translations could be argued (eg, "memory address" as "address ng memorya")
column5: Word-for-word; no effort to adapt terms.

column1: Jollibee is a famous fast food restaurant in the Philippines.
column2: Ang Jollibee ay isang sikat na kainan sa Pilipinas.
column4: Better to phrase it as “Ang Jollibee ay isa sa mga sikat na kainan sa Pilipinas”
column5:
- accurate translation
- good grammar

column1: Filipinos visit their relatives during holidays.
column2: Tuwing bakasyon, binibisita ng mga Pilipino ang kani-kanilang mga pamilya
column4: Better to use and phrase it as “Tuwing bakasyon, binibisita ng mga Filipino ang kani-kanilang mga mahal sa buhay.” Filipino not Pilipino, and also best to use mahal sa buhay for a more deeper and authentic translation rather than using the direct translation of family (pamilya).
column5:
- accurate translation
- good grammar

column1: Filipinos often use the expression "po" and "opo" as a sign of respect to elders.
column2: Ginagamit ng mga Pilipino ang mga salitang “po” at “opo” bilang paggalang sa mga nakakatanda.
column4: Filipino not Pilipino. Change and take note of this.
column5:
- accurate translation
- good grammar

column1: Adobo is one of the most popular dishes in the Philippines, made with soy sauce, vinegar, and garlic.
column2: Ang Adobo ay isa sa mga pinakasikat na ulam sa Pilipinas at ito ay gawa sa toyo, suka, at bawang.
column4: Perfect translation.
column5:
- not sure if “sa” in “gawa sa” is the right word?? but if it’s conversational it’s fine
- kung formal i’d probably say “gawa gamit ang”

column1: The hospitability of Filipinos are known worldwide

column1: We love to celebrate fiestas and gatherings with family and friends

column5: salo-salo could be replaced with pagtitipon for accurate translation

column1: Adobo and sinigang are just some of the delicious Filipino dishes that are truly craved.
column2: Ang adobo at sinigang ay ilan lamang sa masasarap na pagkaing Pilipino na talaga naman hinahanap-hanap

column5: accurate translation

column1: Eating rice with almost every meal is part of out culture

column1: The nurse inserted the IV incorrectly, causing bruising.
column2: Ang nurse ay pinasok ang IV ng mali, kaya nagka-pasa.
column4: translation feels too direct and it ended up having awkward phrasing
column5: Direct translation. There could've been a better term.

column1: The patient was given penicillin to prevent infection.
column2: Ang pasyente ay binigyan ng penicillin upang maiwasan ang impeksyon.
column4: its clear, fluent, formal, and natural, it conveys the clinical intent without making the translation sound forced
column5: Correct translation, and it is not awkward to read as it can be comprehended easily.

column1: To be able to start fasting, you have to stop eating and drinking anything except water at least 8 hours before your test.
column2: Para makapagsimula ng fasting, tigilan ang pagkain at pag-inom 8 oras bago ang test, tubig lang pwede.
column4: "tigilan" is awkward in the context making the phrasing weird and casual, and "pwede" makes the instruction sound optional when it should be strict.
column5: The whole sentence sounds awkward, and the number 8 could've been translated into its word form.

column1: After being checked up, you have to be admitted to the hospital for observation and treatment.
column2: Pagkatapos ng check-up, kailangang ma-admit ka sa ospital para ma-obserbahan at gamutan.
column4: translation became to literal, "ma-admit", "ma-oberserbahan", and "check-up" are mixed Fil-Eng and sound awkward in formal medical writing.
column5: The sentence is a bit awkward, especially some parts of the sentence were not translated properly into its corresponding translation (code switching).

column1: I always make it a priority to set aside time for my hobbies.
column2: Lagi ko sinisigurado na maglaan ng oras para sa aking mga libangan.
column4: translation overall has the same meaning but uses different words like sinisigurado
column5: translation of sentence is "I ensure..." rather than "I always prioritize..."

column1: One of the purposes of life is to help others without expecting anything in return.
column2: Isa sa layunin ng buhay ay ang tumulong sa kapwa nang walang kapalit
column4: translation is natural and meaning is well conveyed
column5: correct and natural sounding translation

column1: I exclusively use Spotify to listen to music such as OPM.
column2: Sa Spotify lang ako nakikinig ng music katulad ng OPM.
column4: decent translation but awkward wording
column5: awkard phrasing

column1: I have a large collection of non-fiction books that's always well-organized and clean.
column2: Meron akong koleksyon ng mga non-fiction na libro na palagi ko sinisigurado na organisado at malinis.
column4: translation is understandable but phrasing and wording can be improved on
column5: did not translate "large" and awkward translation of "well-organized"

column1: Taking crazy things seriously is a serious waste of time.
column2: Ang pagseseryoso ng mga bagay na baliw ay isang seryosong pag-aaksaya ng oras.
column4: Captures tone and meaning well, using native-sounding phrasing without sounding forced or literal.
column5: It uses words that flow naturally and matches the tone accurately.

column1: Things outside you are projections of what’s inside you, and what’s inside you is a projection of what’s outside.
column2: Ang mga bagay sa labas mo ay salamin ng nasa loob mo, at ang nasa loob mo ay salamin ng nasa labas.
column4: Accurate and clear, though some of the poetic impact is slightly reduced.
column5: The translation replaces a complex phrase with a simpler metaphor.

column1: Some men are born mediocre, some men achieve mediocrity, and some men have mediocrity thrust upon them.
column2: May ilang lalaking ipinanganak na katamtaman, may ilang nakakamit ang pagiging karaniwan, at may ilan na ipinipilit na lamang sa kanila ang pagiging ganoon.
column4: It mimics the original text's rhythm until the last part, where it reads too literal.
column5: Preserves the structure and meaning well, though katamtaman and ganoon are odd word choices.

column1: Mother died today. Or maybe yesterday; I can't be sure.
column2: Sumakabilang-buhay si Inay ngayong araw. O baka kahapon; medyo nalilito na ako.
column4: The tone in the translated text feels too colloquial.
column5: Doesn't feel natural. Too literal.

column1: The wave returns to the ocean, where it came from, and where it's supposed to be.
column2: Bumabalik ang alon sa karagatan, kung saan ito nanggaling, at kung saan ito dapat nasa.
column4: The wording feels awkward and unnatural.
column5: Extremely unnatural wording, especially on "kung saan ito dapat nasa." Despite that, it still conveys the rough meaning of the original text.

column1: Sick of tea?! That's like being sick of breathing!
column2: Ayaw mo na ng tsaa?! Parang sinabi mo na ring sawa ka nang huminga!
column4: Wording is natural and uses appropriate that properly conveys the emotion in the sentence.
column5: Exceptionally natural translation. Even conveying the emotional surprise and colloquial tone of the original text.

column1: I wanted to invite my youngest to go get some ice cream, if he’ll let me.
column2: Gusto ko imbitahin yung pinakabata kong anak para kumuha ng ice cream, kung papayagan niya ako.
column4: Not the best translation while its mostly correct its not natural, for more casual contexts yayain is more commonly used, additionally youngest child has a word in tagalog called "bunso" that would be more appropriate here.
column5: Although the meaning of the original sentence is there, the delivery is very stinted, especially on its word usage (pinakabata and imbitahin).

column1: That person has no more respect or love for you, leave them.
column2: Wala nang respeto at pagmamahal yung tao para sa'yo, iwan mo na.
column4: The sentence flows very well and uses more informal words used in conversation like sa'yo.
column5: Sounds very natural, capturing the sentiment carried by the original sentence.
